newsitem.title: FINLAND: METRA SAYS BONUS ISSUE TO BOOST LIQUIDITY.
newsitem.headline: METRA SAYS BONUS ISSUE TO BOOST LIQUIDITY.

text.p: Finnish engineering group Metra Oy Ab said on Wednesday a one-for-one bonus issue it announced earlier was aimed at fuelling liquidity in its shares.
"We want to boost liquidity of the B share," Metra CEO Georg Ehrnrooth told a news conference: the increased number of shares on the market and a lower unit price would help, he said.
The bonus issue will lift the more liquid B stock's share of all Metra stock to about 75 percent from about 50 percent, he said.
Metra said earlier its board would propose to the annual general meeting on March 24 a bonus issue by giving shareholders one new B share for each A share held, and a new B share for each B share.
Each Metra A share carries 10 votes: each B share carries one vote.
The 12 biggest shareholders held 52.9 percent of votes and 38.4 percent of shares in Metra at the end of 1996, Metra said.
Consumer goods group Fiskars Oy Ab was the biggest owner with 22.1 percent of votes and 15.1 percent of shares.
